column4: yo, i just installed apache2 on 10.04 server and I can't load the default page, do I need to do something to apparmor ?
it works locally via lynx but I can't get the page from the host computer that I'm on.  I'm running the ubuntu 10.04 server in a VM
I can SSH to it just fine so I know it's not a host<-> VM networking issue
port 80 open in firewall?
is there a firewall installed in server by default?
ufw is installed but not running, but iptables is
iptables -L comes up blank
'stop ufw' did it, thx
is there something similar to 'chkconfig ufw off' to disable it from starting on boot?
i would start ufw again and open port 80
it's just a local dev server on my laptop, I don't really want to run / manage a firewall on it
sudo ufw allow 80
oh ok
but thanks for the info.  Do you know if that allows UDP / TCP when you just type "ufw allow 80" ?
think it def to tcp
not to keep pushing firewall but you could also enable it again and allow all traffic from your local network and block other
OK, thanks for your help.  UFW seems to be less of a PITA than the default RHEL firewall :)
real easy to use, i used it till i found apf
we use APF for production stuff :)
in reguards to highlighting text in chat - @username should be an option too i think, but thats just me
i love it- had no problems exept today i setup samba and cant for like of me access it on windows pc even though all ports open - soon as turn off able to access
